abstract: American Civil Liberties Union urges the Justice Department to tighten restrictions on the Federal Bureau of Investigation's powers after making public documents that show the bureau has collected information about religious, ethnic and national-origin characteristics of American communities; the FBI denies that it is basing investigative activity solely on religion, race or ethnicity.
snippet: The F.B.I. says agents are analyzing potential threats within their areas of responsibility, and not using factors like race or religion as sole rationales for investigation.
lead_paragraph: The F.B.I. says agents are analyzing potential threats within their areas of responsibility, and not using factors like race or religion as sole rationales for investigation.

headline.main: F.B.I. Scrutinized for Amassing Data on American Communities
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Scrutinized for Amassing Data on Ethnic and Religious Groups
headline.seo: A.C.L.U. Releases F.B.I. Documents on Ethnic and Religious Groups
